title: Acute Limb Ischemia - Race Against Time
subtitle: 6 hours to save a limb
condition: Acute limb ischemia - embolic from atrial fibrillation
educational_focus: 6 Ps of acute ischemia, Fogarty thromboembolectomy, time-critical decision making

characters.name: Ms. Taylor
characters.description: 55-year-old with atrial fibrillation and sudden leg ischemia

panels.title: 3 AM Emergency Call
panels.setting: Hospital corridor at night, urgent atmosphere
panels.visual_prompt: Dora-style cartoon: Camila answering phone in corridor, Camilo and Diego rushing with clipboards, concerned expressions, dark windows showing nighttime

dialogue.speaker: Phone
dialogue.text: URGENT: 55-year-old with sudden dead leg in ER!

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: 3 AM call - this is serious!

dialogue.speaker: Diego
dialogue.text: Race against time starts NOW!

panels.title: The Dramatic Presentation
panels.visual_prompt: Ms. Taylor on stretcher clutching LEFT leg, leg shown pale/white compared to RIGHT leg which is normal color, pain expression on face, team examining

dialogue.speaker: Ms. Taylor
dialogue.text: My leg! It went cold and numb suddenly - I can't feel it!

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: When did this start?

dialogue.speaker: Ms. Taylor
dialogue.text: 3 hours ago! The pain is unbearable!

panels.title: The 6 Ps Assessment
panels.visual_prompt: Camila examining leg with checklist showing 6 Ps on clipboard: Pain ✓, Pallor ✓, Pulselessness ✓, Paresthesia ✓, Paralysis ✓, Poikilothermia ✓. Arrows pointing to affected leg showing each sign

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: The 6 Ps are ALL positive - this is critical!

dialogue.speaker: Diego
dialogue.text: Pain, Pallor, no Pulse, Paresthesia, Paralysis, cold temperature...

dialogue.speaker: Camilo
dialogue.text: Rutherford Class IIb - we have maybe 6 hours!

panels.title: Finding the Cause
panels.setting: Review of medical records at computer
panels.visual_prompt: Camilo at computer showing ECG on screen with irregular rhythm, team clustered around looking at irregular heartbeat pattern

dialogue.speaker: Camilo
dialogue.text: Look at this ECG - atrial fibrillation!

dialogue.speaker: Diego
dialogue.text: That's the source - a clot from the heart!

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: Embolic occlusion of the femoral artery!

panels.title: Immediate Action - Anticoagulation
panels.visual_prompt: Nurse starting IV heparin drip, large syringe and IV bag visible, Camila explaining to patient, clock showing 3:30 AM

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: Starting heparin NOW to prevent more clots!

dialogue.speaker: Ms. Taylor
dialogue.text: What happens next?

dialogue.speaker: Diego
dialogue.text: We need to remove that clot surgically - FAST!

panels.title: Dr. Erben Arrives
panels.visual_prompt: Dr. Erben arriving in scrubs, team briefing with anatomy diagram of leg showing femoral artery with clot, urgent expressions

dialogue.speaker: Dr. Erben
dialogue.text: Time is muscle! Let's do a Fogarty embolectomy!

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: Patient consented - OR is ready!

dialogue.speaker: Dr. Erben
dialogue.text: Every minute counts. Let's save this limb!

panels.title: Rush to OR
panels.visual_prompt: Team rushing stretcher through corridor, motion lines showing speed, clock showing 4:00 AM, OR doors ahead

dialogue.speaker: Camilo
dialogue.text: OR 3 is prepped and waiting!

dialogue.speaker: Diego
dialogue.text: Fogarty catheters ready!

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: Let's go, team!

panels.title: OR Setup
panels.visual_prompt: OR with surgical lights, instruments laid out including Fogarty balloon catheters (show balloon), team in full scrubs, patient leg prepped and draped

dialogue.speaker: Dr. Erben
dialogue.text: Local anesthesia with sedation - we need to check pulses immediately!

dialogue.speaker: Camila
dialogue.text: Sterile field ready!

dialogue.speaker: Camilo
dialogue.text: Doppler ready for post-op assessment!
